result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Relay Sheet / Identification Processing / DNA at Arrest

11:30 AM - case called.  Defendant Melissa F Garcia in court.  Attorney David Gardner Casey in court for Melissa F Garcia.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin - Defendant will be waiving the preliminary hearing.  Court questions Atty Casey/Defendant.  Responses by Atty Casey/Defendant.  Defendant has signed a waiver form.  Court finds the waiver of the preliminary hearing is free and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed with the Court.  In receipt - waive reading - plea of not guilty.  Court accepts not guilty plea.  Bond will continue.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
